args.natural_language_statement: Let x, y ∈ ℝ. Prove the reverse triangle inequality: | |x| - |y| | ≤ |x - y|. Translate into Lean4 (import Mathlib at top) and end the statement with := by sorry.

result:
{"ok": true, "lean_translation": "import Mathlib
open Lean Meta
open Elab Tactic

/-- Generate a `calc` block with the given hypothesis and goal. -/
def elabCalc (hyp : Option Expr) (goal : MVarId) : TacticM (List MVarId) := sorry"}

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Reverse triangle inequality on the reals: | |x| - |y| | ≤ |x - y|. -/
theorem abs_sub_abs_le_abs_sub (x y : Real) : | |x| - |y| | ≤ |x - y| := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-- Reverse triangle inequality on the reals: | |x| - |y| | ≤ |x - y|. -/
theorem abs_sub_abs_le_abs_sub (x y : Real) : |(|x| - |y|)| ≤ |x - y| := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Reverse triangle inequality on the reals: | |x| - |y| | ≤ |x - y|. -/
theorem jirilebl_reverse_triangle_real (x y : Real) : abs (abs x - abs y) ≤ abs (x - y) := by sorry
